page.title: 03VALE OF CLWYD COMMON GRAZING
page.content: The higher ground outside the block on the Eastern side is common land.Some farmers in the block graze sheep there.This is called{Cynefin}in Welsh.(Literal meaning habitat)The usual breed are Welsh mountain.They are hardy and cope with rough land.Grazing right is attached to the flock.The owner forfeits his right to graze if he doesn't register the flock.In the case of a tenant farmer ,the landlord holds the right.Breeding ewes yearlings & lambs are ear tagged and taken up to the hills around May, depending on the weather.Lambs for fattening are brought down in late summer and breeding ewes are brought to the home farm for{tupping}in October.The sheep are overwintered on the lower ground.
